runs.comm: gallops in, pitches slightly back of a length, on middle and leg, de Kock taps gently into the on side
length on the stumps, angling in with the arm and worked into a gap at midwicket this time
Dougie's close to 140kph, getting decent carry as the right-handed Hendricks leaves a length ball in the channel
pulls out of the shot, short ball from Bollinger, skips off the surface and Hendricks aborts his horizontal swipe
goodish length, maybe a touch short and pushed across towards the slips, Hendricks opens the bat face and runs one to third man

flicked off the pads, de Kock using the angle and Bollinger's pace, this is neatly played because it has eluded James Faulkner running from deep square leg, diving attempt but can't prevent the ball rolling on to the ropes
around the wicket, flat and around the line of off, Hendrick nurdles to the leg side for one
fuller length, de Kock leans out and dabs one into a gap at midwicket
darted on leg stump, 93kph and again clipped off the pads for a single
on the stumps, reaches out and drives to find the cover fielder on the edge of the ring
goes back and opens the face, short third man does good work but can't prevent the single
tight line on the stumps and primly tucked through the leg side for one more
on the stumps, Hendricks nudges off his hips into a gap at short midwicket
beaten for pace, back of a length and de Kock rolled his wrists on an attempted pull, no bat on it
shuffles across and steers the ball into a gap at midwicket
good line from Bollinger, no room for Hendricks to swing the arms, blocked back towards the bowler
Dougie likes this, gives the batsman a stare in his follow through, Hendricks only able to prod a length ball to point
length in the channel, 139kph and Hendricks gets this away down to third man, gliding it off the face
starts on the money and Hendricks inside-edges through his legs, short fine leg is quickly on it but needed a direct hit to test de Kock
gets hold of him and that's a Dorothy, straight down the ground! Pitched up and de Kock targets the short boundary, free swing of the arms and it thuds into the boards - lovely sight
length delivery and de Kock pulls at it, doesn't manage to connect
skips forward and manufactures a cross-batted drive wide of mid-off
on the stumps, length delivery pushed back to the bowler
fuller, in the channel, Hendricks is forward on the drive and a thickish edge runs to third man
back of a length and carted over backward square, Hendricks has got this away, swivelled quickly to flip it off his hips
back of a length and paddled of the stumps through midwicket for a couple
width and sliced over backward point this time, Bollinger doesn't have any cover out there and Hendricks carves himself another four
stays in the crease and steers this one down to third man
dismissive from de Kock, pulled powerfully over mid-on and away for the third boundary of the over! The pitch is maybe holding up a touch, Bollinger not quite quick enough and de Kock batters him
shortish, goes back and deflects one to short third man
down the leg side, de Kocks swings hard... wide
better line, in the channel outside off, de Kock heaves again, misses
back of a length, at the batsman, helped round the corner and this beats short fine leg and will run away
smeared over cover, de Kock is on the charge! Using the feet again, comes out to thump a length ball to the boundary
dug in shorter, the connection on the pull isn't clean but they pick up a couple into the leg side
opens up his stance and steers the ball through point, they get back for two
angled across the lefty, who goes back and chops one more through backward point
length ball outside off, clipped down the ground
on the stumps, worked off the legs
flat and around the line of off, de Kock gets forward and steers one more into a gap on the off side
very full, dips a little on off stump and Hendricks drops his bat on it
allows this to come across him and steers the ball through cover point, wide of the sweeper
full, gives this a bit of flight, flicked away through midwicket
starts with a legbreak that skis on a little low outside off, Hendricks jabs it away
tossed up, on the stumps, de Kock comes down the track and jams his bat next to pad
gives this some air, de Kock comes out of his crease, cross-bats it down the ground to long-off
tossed up on middle and off, worked through the leg side
whipped away, de Kock wristily pulling a length ball flat and hard, it spins and pierces the gap behind deep midwicket, super stroke
flighted, worked with the turn through the leg side, finds space again - de Kock is sailing here
starts in the channel outside off, good length and steered straight to point
Hendricks this time goes back and guides a similar-length delivery down to third man
slower ball, de Kock hasn't picked this... but he's still hit it for six! He was aiming down the ground and that's where it ended up, just managing to clear the rope despite the miscue
got him, Cummins makes the breakthrough with a fast short ball! Banged in, little bit of cut on the ball and de Kock was hurried trying to pull, just a tickle of glove and it's safely pouched by Dunk
good length, outside off and 141kph, nicely played first ball, leaning out to drive wide of the man at cover
short again and this is pulled fiercely through midwicket to the man in the deep
on the stumps and worked through the leg side
angled across, plays back in the crease and a thick outside edge falls short of point
flat and straight, can't get this through the leg side
tight lines from Maxwell, darting the ball in, this time Hendricks manages to find a gap at deep midwicket
on the stumps, worked away into a gap off the pads for two more
flat, outside off, driven into the ground and White can't grab it at cover, they pick up one on the misfield
back of a length, 142kph and blocked back on the leg side
short ball, climbing outside off, clattered to backward square leg on the pull, superb timing from Hendricks
back of a length and again in the channel, not short enough to pull and Hendricks lets the ball through
goes across his stumps and works to the ball to leg, fielded in the ring
length in the channel and dabbed into the covers
slightly fuller, Hendricks closes the face and again works the ball to midwicket - another dot and an excellent over from Cummins, having been hit for four second ball

tossed up, Rossouw charges... and picks out long-on! Success for Boyce, he keeps tossing it up, Rossouw was trying to clear the short, straight boundary - the ball was a little wide, he wasn't to the pitch and dragged it straight to the fielder
pitching and straightening outside leg, flicked fine and Bollinger has to give chase
gives this some air, spinning back in from outside off, cut away off the back foot
flatter and outside the right-hander's off stump, punched through the off side to the sweeper
goes across and clips another business-like single through the covers
tossed up, straightens and takes the outside edge, loops safely into the off side
on the stumps, can't get this away
darted down around off stump, Miller plants through front foot and forces this through the covers
fullish and straight, Hendricks gets down the pitch and hoicks over wide long-on, well struck and it bounces away for four
flat trajectory, nurdled away through square leg
goes deep in the crease, pushes one down the ground
pushed through flatter on off stump, Hendricks jams the bat down on it
tossed up, Miller is quickly out of the crease and clubs this straight back down the ground, no one is stopping that
flatter and worked off the pads through midwicket
pushed through outside off, drops back and steers one through the off side
happy to stay in the crease and punch down the ground
flighted, full and swept, superb connection from Hendricks, a controlled stroke and it skips away past the fielder at deep square leg
pushed through and Hendricks drops back, punches through the covers for another single
starts on a length outside off, maybe a change of pace and Hendricks fails to get bat on ball
angled in and this time Hendricks flicks the ball away to leg
length on off stump, Miller can only jab it back towards the bowler
slightly back of a length, 136kph, Miller pushes through mid-on, just a single
pushed across the right-hander, who reaches out to steer through the covers
accurate stuff from Faulkner, whipped away through midwicket for one more
slightly back of a length, Miller sits in the crease and clips through square leg

Dougie does it, Hendricks drags on! The ball was short and there to pull but maybe Bollinger had rolled his fingers over it, the batsman misjudged the stroke, bottom-edged the ball on to his body and then down to shiver leg stump. Falls just short of the fifty mark, like his opening partner
skips down the pitch and tries to heave a length ball over midwicket, swings and misses
leg-stump line again, aims to leg and the ball rolls away off the pad
back of a length, 133kph but zipping through and above Miller's flat-batted swipe
it's the bluff, Bollinger goes full and straight, Miller gets a chunk of inside edge on it and deep midwicket has to race in, they sprint for two
length ball, angled across, Behardien plinks it into the off side
back-of-the-hand slower ball from Faulkner, bottom-edged pull through square leg as Behardien again tries to hit a home run
short of a length, at the body, Miller swivel-pulls to leg
shortish and taken on... only to pick out deep midwicket! Behardien's brief, painful sally is brought to a close, slogging across the line but never had to the distance to that part of the ground
short again, Faulkner making the batsmen go square of the wicket, pulled into the deep for a couple
too full and Miller scorches a drive down the ground, wide of long-off, a powerful counterpunch to finish the over
banged in short, Duminy skips forward, mistime his pull back down the track
short again, Duminy swats a pull away into the midwicket region
slower ball from Cummins, short again and cross-batted through the leg side
another slower-ball bumper, down the leg side - maybe lucky not to be a wide - Duminy swings and misses but the low bounce foxes Dunk and they take a bye
short, another cutter, pulled flat out towards deep midwicket
Cummins continues to hit the middle of the pitch and limit the pace the batsman has to use again him, swatted into the midwicket region, they think about two but the fielder is quickly in
tries to get to the pitch, Duminy lifts a length ball to deep midwicket! Another one goes, the SA innings is dribbling to a close... He was hitting across the line and didn't really get hold of it
back of a length, Miller steps away and drags one down the ground to long-on

gone first ball, edging a pull through to the keeper! Two in three balls for Faulkner, the slump continues. It was another back-of-a-length delivery, Wiese hadn't got his eye in and succeeded only in feathering it through to Dunk
shortish, Peterson comes forward and slices a single to backward point
HEADS! Faulkner has to take evasive action here, slightly too full and Miller nearly turns killer with a scud missile of a drive straight back down the pitch. Phwoar
uses the feet and swings hard at a length ball, big top edge but it sails safely out towards deep cover to keep Miller on strike
dug in short and there's a big appeal as Miller aims a pull, deflects through to the keeper - well spotted, ump, that came off the shoulder
another bumper, connects with this one, swatted into the deep but they're kept to a single
back of a length, cutting his fingers over it, Peterson swipes and misses
slower ball, Peterson drops right back in the crease and deflects it to point, Miller was already halfway down
banged in halfway down and pulled forcefully but too close to deep midwicket, Peterson half-heartedly sets off for a second but has to go back

short, again taking the pace off, Peterson shovels it awkwardly into the leg side, deep midwicket has a lot of ground to cover and they come scrambling back for the second - still, a magnificent over from Cummins at the last
